unnormalised: Someone asked me, "How much does a typical grocery run cost in Mumbai these days?" Well, bhai, that depends a lot on where you're shopping and what you're buying! A small trip to the local kirana store for essentials like 1 kg of onions, 1 liter of milk, and maybe a packet of Parle-G might set you back ₹250-₹300. But that's just the bare minimum, ya know?
normalised: Someone asked me, "How much does a typical grocery run cost in Mumbai these days?" Well, bhai, that depends a lot on where you're shopping and what you're buying! A small trip to the local kirana store for essentials like one kilogram of onions, one liter of milk, and maybe a packet of P-a-r-l-e-G might set you back rupee two hundred and fifty to rupee three hundred. But that's just the bare minimum, ya know?

unnormalised: If you're heading to a fancy supermarket like D-Mart or Reliance Fresh, expect to pay more. Especially if you're stocking up on imported goodies or organic veggies. A similar basket could easily cost you ₹500-₹700. And don't even get me started on the weekend hauls! Those can easily cross ₹2000, esp. if you’re buying for the whole family.
normalised: If you're heading to a fancy supermarket like D-M-a-r-t or Reliance Fresh, expect to pay more. Especially if you're stocking up on imported goodies or organic veggies. A similar basket could easily cost you rupee five hundred to rupee seven hundred. And don't even get me started on the weekend hauls! Those can easily cross rupee two thousand, especially if you’re buying for the whole family.

unnormalised: Then there's the local markets, like Crawford Market. You can find some amazing deals there, but you gotta bargain hard! You might be able to snag 5 kg of mangoes for ₹400, but the quality can be hit or miss. Plus, travelling there and back in Mumbai traffic is a whole other expense and time investment.
normalised: Then there's the local markets, like Crawford Market. You can find some amazing deals there, but you gotta bargain hard! You might be able to snag five kilogram of mangoes for rupee four hundred, but the quality can be hit or miss. Plus, travelling there and back in Mumbai traffic is a whole other expense and time investment.

unnormalised: So, a typical grocery run? I'd say somewhere between ₹300 to ₹2000, depending on your needs and preferences. And don't forget to factor in the auto-rickshaw fare or petrol costs, boss! Plus, inflation is hitting hard these days; prices seem to be going up by the day!
normalised: So, a typical grocery run? I'd say somewhere between rupee three hundred to rupee two thousand, depending on your needs and preferences. And don't forget to factor in the auto-rickshaw fare or petrol costs, boss! Plus, inflation is hitting hard these days; prices seem to be going up by the day!
